Bachelor of Social Work

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Accreditation CSWE

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The Bachelor’s degree program in Social Work (B.S.W.) is designed to prepare majors for professional, entry-level generalist social work practice and graduate study. With a liberal arts perspective and knowledge base and buttressed by professional foundation of social work knowledge, values and skills, the B.S.W. program is Bennett’s singular academic area for the preparation of trained social and human service professionals who work with individuals, families, groups, communities, and organizations, for resolution or modification of social problems.

In-State Tuition: $80,465

Out of State Tuition: $80,465

Credits: 121

Completion: 48 months

GPA: 2.5

Letter of Recommendation: No

Essay Required: No

Test Required: ACT/SAT Required

You're on your way!

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $81,130

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The Mission of the Bachelor of Science Program in Computer Science at Bennett College for Women is to instill the student with essential facts, concepts, principles, theories, and applications relating to computer science. Graduates of the program understand not only the theoretical foundations of the discipline but also how that theory influences and is applied in practice. The program provides a foundation that allows the student to study at graduate level and/or to work in industry, maintaining their skills in the rapidly changing field.

In-State Tuition: $81,130

Out of State Tuition: $81,130

Credits: 122

Completion: 48 months

GPA: 2.5

Letter of Recommendation: No

Essay Required: No

Test Required: ACT/SAT Required

Bachelor of Science in Chemistry

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The Department of Biological and Chemical Sciences provides a curriculum for the Bachelor of Science in Chemistry for chemistry majors who wish to pursue chemistry or an allied science field as a profession. The department also provides excellent preparation for those interested in gaining admission to medical or dental schools. The department provides instruction in chemistry for students majoring in other fields of science. The department also offers a minor in chemistry

Out of State Tuition: $80,465

Bachelor of Science in Business Administration

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $79,800

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

Coursework for a Business Administration major requires sixty-three (63) credit hours of courses in Accounting, Business, Economics and Finance. Our major in Business Administration requires completion of all sixty-three (63) credit hours with a grade of C or above in each course. The remaining fifty-nine credit hours are allocated to General Education courses (44) and Electives (15), for students to further explore other disciplines that complement the Business Administration major and other interests. See Curriculum Pattern for details.

In-State Tuition: $79,800

Out of State Tuition: $79,800

Credits: 120

Completion: 48 months

GPA: 2.5

Letter of Recommendation: No

Essay Required: No

Test Required: ACT/SAT Required

You're on your way!

Bachelor of Science in Biology

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The Mission of the Biology Program is to prepare students for careers in research, teaching, biological and medical fields, industry and government, and for admission to graduate, medical, dental, allied health and other health profession schools. The Mission of the Bachelor of Science in Biology is in alignment with the Mission of the College to develop scholarship, leadership, and global acumen within the students within the Department. Through offering core biology courses supplemented with biology electives, the Department meets the needs of our students via providing a curriculum, which develops proficiency in the biological sciences needed to succeed in graduate school, professional school and the science industry.

In-State Tuition: $80,465

Out of State Tuition: $80,465

Credits: 121

Completion: 48 months

GPA: 2.5

Letter of Recommendation: No

Essay Required: No

Test Required: ACT/SAT Required

You're on your way!

Performance

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The Theatre Program is intended to prepare students for professional careers in their field and/or to perform successfully in paraprofessional and graduate school programs in Theatre. The intent of the Theatre program is to nurture and develop students to their fullest potential.

Bachelor of Arts in Psychology

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The goal of the Bennett College Psychology BA/ BS degree program is to prepare students for graduate school and career entry, to promote the value of lifelong learning, and to enable students to acquire the skills and knowledge they will need to become leaders and engaged members of their communities. To these ends and in accordance with the APA Guidelines for the Psychology Major (2013), students are required to assemble a knowledge base in psychology, to develop their capacity for critical thinking and engaging in scientific inquiry, to develop an awareness of their ethical and social responsibilities, to become adept at oral and written communication, and to apply what they have learned to their own personal, scholarly, and professional development.

In-State Tuition: $80,465

Out of State Tuition: $80,465

Credits: 121

Completion: 48 months

GPA: 2.5

Essay Required: No

Test Required: ACT/SAT Required

Bachelor of Arts in Political Science

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The program offers a broad range of courses drawn from the diverse field of political science – American Government, Public Administration, International Relations, Comparative Politics, Political Theory, and Research Methods in Political Science. Courses in political science help students learn to think analytically and critically and to communicate effectively. This course of study is helpful in the fields of law, international affairs, and governance.

In-State Tuition: $80,465

Out of State Tuition: $80,465

Performance

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The Music Program aims to produce students who have developed excellence in performance and in the historical and theoretical aspects of music, who have developed skills in leadership roles in leadership roles in the workplace, society and the world, who have developed the practice of lifelong learning in a technologically advanced, complex global society, who are prepared to teach and administer music programs, to attend graduate school and work in music related fields

Bachelor of Arts in Journalism and Media Studies

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The Journalism and Media Studies Major offers students a foundation that provides skills required to become professional communicators. JMS majors are encouraged to be committed to scholarship and critical thinking, theoretical experiences (e.g., course work, seminars, and workshops), and a variety of practical opportunities (e.g., internships; digital, print and broadcast productions). The JMS department seeks to teach and maintain the highest standards of journalism ethics and professionalism.

In-State Tuition: $80,465

Out of State Tuition: $80,465

Credits: 121

Completion: 48 months

GPA: 2.5

Essay Required: No

Bachelor of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies

Traditional

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The goals of the Interdisciplinary Studies Program - Traditional Option/Honors at Bennett College, is to support the institutional goals of scholarly excellence and leadership preparation, and to enhance life-long learning through the development of educational experiences that include an emphasis on the development of Major Concentrations that reflect the academic focus and interests of each student enrolled. Participating Students are provided with academic frameworks that emphasize involvement in internships of the kind that allow for on site learning within the wider community, and that are undergirded by core courses that emphasize the exemplary development of the students' own Written and Oral Communication Skills.

Out of State Tuition: $80,465

Bachelor of Arts in English

Bennett College

Greensboro, North Carolina

Tuition $80,465

Degree Bachelor

Modality On-campus

About Program

Program Details

Admissions

The goal of the English Program at Bennett College is to empower its students as critical thinkers and participating citizens in pursuit of truth, beauty, spirituality, social justice, and global leadership. Furthermore, we seek to prepare scholars who are competitive candidates in graduate and professional schools and their chosen careers, and who are leaders with skills based upon humanistic values - inclusive of effective communication skills, both written and verbal, research skills and critical reading and writing skills that contribute to their ability as impactful problem solvers.

In-State Tuition: $80,465

Out of State Tuition: $80,465

Credits: 121

Completion: 48 months

GPA: 2.5

Letter of Recommendation: No

Essay Required: No

Test Required: ACT/SAT Required
